item.title: Asynchronous Programming
item.description:
What is Asynchronous Programming?

Imagine youâ€™re heating leftover food in the oven. While itâ€™s warming up, you donâ€™t just stand there waiting â€” you start cleaning the dishes and putting them away. The oven continues heating your food in the background, and you finish another task in the meantime. Thatâ€™s asynchronous programming in a nutshell.

Asynchronous basically allows your application to stay responsive no matter the workload.Its a programming paradigm that allows a program to start a task and continue executing other tasks before the first one finishes.

item.title: DOCKER
item.description:
What is DOCKER?

Imagine you have a recipe of a dish you made perfectly at home for your friends and family. Then you pass on your recipe to one of you friends and the food doesnt taste the same as when you made it maybe due to different brand of ingredients etc..

Thats where DOCKER solves the “It works on my machine” within programming.
Docker helps in grouping your application + its environment(dependencies,libraries,OS setup) all into a container. This allows your app to run everywhere the same.

item.title: Understanding and Setting up VOIP with the help of Asterisk
item.description:
Have you ever wondered how does communication with one another work on a network and what is the science behind it. This blog will give a touch on what its like to connect and send digitalized packets over an internet connection

ðŸ§  What is VoIP?

VoIP (Voice over Internet Protocol) is a protocal that allows us humans to perform voice communication over the internet instead of traditional telephone networks (PSTN). Top main communication companies such as Instagram, Whatssapp, Google make use of VOIP in setting up their communication systems

item.title: Setting up a Website using GitHub Pages
item.description:
This is a guide that will help you in creating your own personal website using Hugo, and deplyoing it with GitHub pages

Prerequisites

  • Git installed
  • Hugo installed
  • GitHub Account
  • Knowing how to use the terminal

Step 1: Installing Hugo

I use Arch so i installed it using:

sudo pacman -S hugo

For Debian/Ubuntu users:

sudo apt install hugo

Step 2: Creating you hugo site

Open terminal and run:

hugo new site<enter name of site> #this allows to install all the main files that hugo allows
cd <name of your site>

Step 3: Choosing theme:

There are many themes you can choose from on the Hugo site Hugo Themes.I chose PaperMod because it has a very slick and clean look to it.

item.title: Beginner guide to Git and GitHub
item.description:
title: “Content Placeholder” build: render: never list: never publishResources: false

Are you just starting out in programming? Great! Let me introduce you to two of your soon-to-be best friends: Git and GitHub.

What Is Git?

Git is a version control system. Imagine you’re working on a big project. You want to save different versions of it, go back to a previous version if something breaks, and collaborate with friends without losing work. That’s what Git helps you do.
